nodes.bodyText:
let's this default behaviour. When needed for manual tests, user could configure launcher on their own.
Also let's not use env variable for that, but regular cli parameter.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -57,5 +57,6 @@ jobs:
           rm -rf ~/.m2/repository
       - name: Product Tests
         run: |
+          export PTL_BIND_PORTS=false

nodes.bodyText: i want env up to expose ports by default and i didn't find a better way to achieve this
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -57,5 +57,6 @@ jobs:
           rm -rf ~/.m2/repository
       - name: Product Tests
         run: |
+          export PTL_BIND_PORTS=false

nodes.bodyText: make it false on default. Also I would remove PTL_BIND_PORTS env variable, I don't see a need it for right now.
Add logging that ports are not going to be exposed to host. Also please mention what user needs to do to expose them.

nodes.bodyText: How can we be sure that we have not exposed ports directly using TestcontainersUtil ?

we cannot.
in fact, we expose (debug) ports directly when --debug
ideas for improvement?
